title: US carries out new air strikes in Iraq, sees erosion of Isis 'morale' â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: obama calls on sisi to release 'those journalists '
fbi : us has identified killer in isis hostage videos .
pentagon on syrian trainees : 'we have n't even started '
rouhani : 'we hope for final accord ' on nuclear program .
human rights lawyer executed in mosul .
uae confirms female pilot involved in air strikes .

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : kurdish fighters called for us air strikes around the border town of kobani , which has come under assault from isis militants .
about 140,000 kurdish refugees were driven into turkey by the assault in the last week .
some had returned .
president obama praised the work of turkish authorities to handle syrian refugees , in a phone call with turkish president erdoäan .
the british parliament was to convene friday and was expected to vote in favor of participation in military strikes against isis .
obama told egyptian president sisi in a meeting that those journalists should be released .
the pentagon announced no new strikes in syria thursday as of this writing .
it described about a dozen new strikes in iraq .
the pentagon said it had not seen much reaction by isis militants to us-led strikes in syria but we 're definitely having an effect in iraq .
iranian president hassan rouhani called for a final accord on iran 's nuclear program and said further peace deals could follow .
rouhani said strategic blunders by the west had created a safe haven for terrorists .
isis militants killed a human rights lawyer in public in mosul after torturing her for five days for criticism she posted on facebook , the un said .
the united states has identified a british-accented black-clad killer from multiple isis hostage videos , the fbi chief said , not naming him .
read the previous summary here .
from reader kookaroo in the comments , vis-ã -vis the british parliament session tomorrow which we 'd referred to as a debate : debate ?
more like rubber stamp .
the outcome is a forgone conclusion .
point taken .
read the full comment here .

president obama reportedly did not meet with the iranian delegation at the un , but secretary of state kerry is still meeting with them : marie harf ( @ marieharf ) schedule update : @ twitterid will meet trilaterally with eu highrep ashton & iranian fm @ twitterid at the waldorf astoria at 6pm tonight .
us central command has released another video of a strike wednesday on an oil refinery in syria .
mayadin is in the euphrates river valley south of deir ezzor .
u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) .
@ centcom footage of u.s. airstrike on mayadin modular refinery # syria # isil

the guardian us national security editor points out that the obama administration is putting out various and conflicting figures for how many americans are fighting in syria ( and earlier this month the number was 100 ) : spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) monday i 'm told 20-30 americans fighting in syria for various groups today fbi 's comey says 12
the white house has released this description of a phone call between president obama and turkish president erdoäan .

obama praised turkey 's work to host refugees : the president spoke briefly today with president erdogan from air force one to discuss our work together to counter the threat posed by isil in iraq and syria , including steps we can take to advance our already strong cooperation .

the president praised the work turkish authorities and local groups , together with the un , are doing to care for the massive influx of refugees flowing into turkey , including tens of thousands this week alone .
following president erdogan 's meeting today with vice president biden , the two presidents agreed to continue to consult closely .
yemen freed at least three suspected iranian revolutionary guard members on thursday , reuters reports .

the three had been held for months over alleged ties to a shia muslim insurgent group that has seized control of much of the capital sanaa , a senior official said : the takeover by the shi'ite houthi rebels came hours before a power-sharing accord was signed with other political parties providing for the creation of a new government .
that effectively made the houthis the main power brokers in yemen , a u.s.-allied country whose political , tribal and sectarian turmoil poses risks to no .
1 oil exporter saudi arabia next door .
it was not immediately clear why the release , which the official said was originally part of a deal to stem the houthi advance on sanaa , went ahead .
but it suggested the shi'ite group was now dictating terms in the capital .
the release of the iranians came a day after yemen freed two suspected members of lebanon 's hezbollah group , the official said .
read the full piece here .
parliament returns tomorrow to debate joining the attack : news ( uk ) ( @ bbcnews ) friday 's guardian : `` mps poised to vote for third iraq campaign '' # bbcpapers via @ twitterid
rouhani sits down with cnn : hassan rouhani ( @ hassanrouhani ) right now , discussing current affairs with @ twitterid

centcom adds detail on thursday 's strikes in iraq , saying they had hit an armed vehicle , fighters , a tank and other vehicles and positions : u.s. central command ( @ centcom ) one airstrike west of irbil , five south of kirkuk , five west of baghdad : # iraq u.s. military forces continued to attack isil terrorists in iraq , using a mix of attack , bomber and fighter aircraft to conduct eleven airstrikes wednesday and today .
one airstrike west of irbil struck isil fighters and damaged an isil armed vehicle .
five airstrikes south of kirkuk struck isil fighters , destroyed an isil tank , an isil vehicle and an isil humvee , and damaged two isil armed vehicles .
five airstrikes west of baghdad destroyed an isil humvee , four checkpoints , a fighting position , two guard towers , and a command post .
vice president joe biden is meeting with turkish president recep tayyip erdoäan , according to a pool report .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : the united states and france carried out air strikes in iraq thursday but there had not been new strikes reported in syria .
as un general assembly activities wound down , president obama met with egyptian president sisi before flying back to washington .
obama told sisi those journalists should be released , according to a white house pool report .
the united states has identified a british-accented black-clad killer from multiple isis hostage videos , the fbi chief said , not naming him .
it appeared that kurdish forces had turned an isis assault in northern syria , around kobani .
the kurds asked for us air strikes .
iraqi security forces are effectively defending baghdad from isis , the pentagon press secretary said , but elsewhere they 're less effective .
isis militants killed a human rights lawyer in public in mosul after torturing her for five days for criticism she posted on facebook , the un said .
read the previous blog summary .

documents.title: obama calls on sisi to release 'those journalists '
text: the white house press secretary and senior advisors spoke to press aboard air force one as the president returned to washington he has now landed there , according to a pool report .
in his meeting with egyptian president abdel fatah al-sisi , president obama said those journalists should be released , according to white house officials .
obama and sisi had a frank discussion , the white house said : the president discussed our ongoing concerns on egypt 's political trajectory .
they had a frank discussion on those issues .
obama also stressed free speech and due process rights as well as concerns about human rights including the detention of journalists .
obama stressed those journalists should be released .

the president did not have any interaction with the iranian delegation , the white house said : we did n't plan to¦ there have been very regular , extended discussions during a period of days and they have been very technical in nature .
¦ the president wants to let that work proceed .
what threat did the united states eliminate when it destroyed sites tied to the so-called khorasan group in idlib two days ago ?

officials are offering varied and conflicting explanations on the precise nature of the threat posed by the group , writes guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) : hours after tomahawk missiles slammed into buildings near aleppo believed to be used by khorasan , an obscure group said to be focused on exporting terrorism from syria , the us military described it as involved in imminent attack plotting against western targets .
yet it is unclear what khorasan was planning , how far that planning advanced , and whether the us itself was a target .
nor is the us confident as yet that it has either killed khorasan 's leaders or significantly degraded any threat khorasan may pose .
us officials , few of whom would speak on the record , insist that the us acted on the best available intelligence and expressed confidence in it .
for days , several have resisted elaboration , citing fear of jeopardizing intelligence sources .
read the full piece here .

and here 's a related piece by al-jazeera 's imran khan expressing his belief that khorasan is almost certainly a term that the us government has coined : in 14 years of covering this region this was a new name for me .
[ ] then the group became the target of us airstrikes in syria and suddenly the name was on every news outlet 's lips .
except something , to me , was n't right .
i began to make some calls to contacts across the middle east and south asia .
to say i drew a blank would be an understatement .
reactions ranged from a hearty laugh to confusion .
the name was new .
read the full piece here .
( h/t @ twitterid )

senior eu officials have said it may already be too late to stop a islamist terror attack in europe as european members of islamic state ( isis ) return from syria and iraq , reoprts guardian europe editor ian traynor ( @ traynorbrussels ) : they said the eu 's bodies and its 28 governments were under intense us pressure to get to grips with the menace represented by thousands of european citizens fighting in syria , but that europe was struggling to develop coherent instruments to reduce the risk of an atrocity .
it is pre-programmed , said a senior official involved in the policy and security debate over the chances of an attack .
we have clear signals that this is what the foreign fighters are doing .
this is the main threat we are facing .
interior ministers from the 28 countries are to meet in luxembourg in a fortnight to try to come up with a concerted policy .
the home affairs council is very aware and very frightened of this ¦ the colleagues in the police administration just do n't know how to cope .
they all fear this could be totally out of control .
it may already be too late , the senior official told the guardian and five other european newspapers .
read the full piece here .
the obama-sisi meeting has wrapped and obama has left to begin his return trip to washington , according to pool reports .

the white house has released a transcipt of a statement made by president obama before the meeting : president obama : well , i want to welcome president el-sisi to new york and to the united states .
and i 'm very much looking forward to this opportunity to share ideas .
obviously , the u.s.-egyptian relationship has been an important cornerstone of our security policy and our policy in the middle east for a very long time .
this is our first opportunity face-to-face to discuss a wide range of issues - everything from the palestinian-israeli situation in gaza , to libya , to the issues of isil , iraq and syria .
and so i want to welcome the president here and his delegation , and i look forward to a constructive , productive conversation .
thank you , everybody .
there 's a rally in support of former egyptian president mohamed morsi , now imprisoned , outside the obama-sisi meeting .
robin wright ( @ wrightr ) pro # morsi/muslim brotherhood rally front my hotel - in new york of course - as # obama met # sisi .
ahhh freedom .
us central command has announced new strikes today in iraq .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) new iraq strikes today , central command announces , near irbil and near kirkuk .
nothing yet re syria today .
syrian refugees are helped by a red crescent worker as they cross the syrian-turkish border near sanliurfa , turkey , 25 september 2014 .
in recent days , turkey has seen the biggest influx ' of syrian refugees since the start of the war three years ago , said the un agency for refugees ( unhcr ) .

suna/epa in this wednesday sept 24 , 2014 image posted on the nusra front social media account , shows a fighter from al-qaida-linked nusra front carries ammunitions , as they move their bases away from the civilian areas , in idlib province , north syria .
/ap

a cruise ship has up hundreds of people , apparently syrian refugees , who were stranded aboard a small boat off cyprus , al jazeera quotes officials as saying : the cruise liner salamis philoxenia was directed to the area to offer assistance on thursday morning after cypriot authorities up a distress signal from the boat , which had hit rough seas off the coast of the eastern mediterranean island .
an image released by the cyprus defence ministry on 25 september 2014 shows a fishing trawler overloaded with people off paphos , cyprus .

a cruise ship rescued 300 syrian migrants crowded into a tiny fishing vessel in rough seas off the southern coast of cyprus after coast guard officials up a distress signal , the defence ministry said .
defence ministry / handout/epa
a photo from inside the obama-sisi meeting : the big pharaoh ( @ thebigpharaoh ) obama-sisi meeting in new york

documents.title: fbi : us has identified killer in isis hostage videos
text: afp up on a james comey statement to abc news : agence france-presse ( @ afp ) # update us has identified is hostage executioner , says fbi chief the united states believes it has identified the masked islamic state militant who murdered two kidnapped american journalists in separate videotaped beheadings , fbi chief james comey said thursday .

the jihadist organization triggered global outrage when it released two videos of a man with a british accent killing first james foley then steven sotloff , freelance journalists who were kidnapped in syria .
update : comey , speaking to a small group of reporters , declined to give further details about the suspect .
he said roughly one dozen americans were known to be fighting with militants in syria , and that many who fought there had already returned to the united states .
the obama-sisi meeting has begun , according to a white house pool report .
it 's the first meeting between the two since sisi was elected president in may 2014 following the coup of 3 july 2013 .
earlier this week , sisi spoke with charlie rose of cbs news .
sisi declined commit the egyptian air force to the fight against isis .
but we are part of the coalition , he said .
the pentagon has released video of an air strike against a target it identifies as the jeribe west modular refinery in northeastern syria .
a before-and-after of the site is here .
did egyptian president abdel fatah al-sisi read the local paper this morning ?

the back page of the front section of the new york times today is a full-page appeal for the release of al-jazeera journalists peter greste , mohamed fahmy and baher mohamed , sentenced to seven to ten years in prison .
sisi is scheduled to meet with obama at the un later this afternoon .
abdullah elshamy ( @ abdallahelshamy ) back cover of @ twitterid today. # freeajstaff

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : the pentagon said it had not seen much reaction by isis militants to us-led strikes in syria but we 're definitely having an effect in iraq .
iraqi security forces are effectively defending baghdad from isis , the pentagon press secretary said , but elsewhere they 're less effective .
it appeared that kurdish forces had turned an isis assault in northern syria , around kobani .
the kurds asked for us air strikes .
isis militants killed a human rights lawyer in public in mosul after torturing her for five days for criticism she posted on facebook , the un said .
uk prime minister david cameron supported military action against isis in a speech at the un , saying britain must not be frozen with fear .
britain detained an extremist preacher who made an inflammatory statement about british aid worker alan henning , an isis hostage .
iranian president hassan rouhani said there was time to reach a final accord on his country 's nuclear program and said doing so could serve as beginning of collaboration on peace .
french fighters struck targets in iraq and strikes in syria were said to be on the table .
france stepped up domestic anti-terrorism precautions .
the pentagon released photos and locations ( see map ) of strikes wednesday it said targeted oil refineries in syria controlled by isis .
the uae and saudi arabia dropped a majority of the bombs on the refineries , the us said .
read the previous blog summary .
we 're going to move the video of british prime minister david cameron 's remarks before the un general assembly from its perch atop this blog .
cameron warned that britain must not be so frozen with fear of repeating the mistakes of the iraq war that it failed to take on the psychopathic , murderous , brutal jihadis .
watch it here : british prime minister tells the un general assembly the world must learn the mistake of past military ventures in iraq , but must not be frozen with fear ' .
cameron says there is a place for iran in the fight against isis , but in the case of syria 's leader bashar al-assad , my enemy 's enemy is not my friend it is another enemy ' .

the united states says it is not communicating with tehran to coordinate its fight against isis militants ( meanwhile : the pentagon sends 68 troops to irbil to support kurdish peshmerga while denying knowledge of a qods force presence there on behalf of the same purpose ) .
within this temporary alignment there is friction , in part stemming from the fact that uae and saudi jets are now dropping bombs on syria .

journalist ali gharib explores the problematic nature from the iranian perspective of the coalition obama has built to take on isis : still , obama 's response to the surprisingly effective marauding in iraq by the virulently anti-shia isis has its own sectarian flavor : the us sided with the same sunni dictators that have fanned sectarian flames .
and america built its coalition of the somewhat-willing at the expense of iran the one country that has been most aggressively aiding military efforts against isis .
comment is free ( @ commentisfree ) obama 's isis coalition was built at iran 's expense , and rouhani knows it , says @ twitterid gharib iran has noticed .

extremists threaten our neighbors , resort to violence and shed blood , said iranian president hassan rouhani at the general assembly thursday , warning that combatting the trend must be entrusted to the people in the region who can deliver .
read the full piece here .

france has upgraded its anti-terrorist measures in the country 's transport system and in public places after fears of reprisal attacks by islamic extremists , the guardian 's kim willsher ( @ kimwillsher1 ) reports in paris : french president franã§ois hollande announced the tightened measures following the beheading of a french hostage in algeria .

hervã© gourdel , 55 , a mountain guide , was kidnapped by a group calling itself soldiers of the caliphate and linked to the fundamentalist islamic state organisation , two days after he arrived in algeria on sunday .
his abductors announced they had killed him on wednesday , 48 hours after their deadline for france to stop air strikes on isis positions in iraq .
after an emergency meeting of defence chiefs on thursday , hollande said the country 's security measures would be tightened .
preventative measures against terrorist risk that are already in place across the nation will be strengthened in public places and in the transport system , said the elysã©e in a statement .
hollande also announced that france would intensify its support for the syrian opposition whose forces are fighting jihadists .
france is reluctant to offer any support to syrian president bashar al-assad , whose government troops are also battle to contain isis .
an elysã©e statement added : the whole of france is in mourning after the barbaric execution of our compatriot .
this crime will not go unpunished .
in such tragic circumstances , national unity is essential .
pilot mariam al-mansouri is a media star : jim sciutto ( @ jimsciutto ) top gun , take two : uae f16 pilot & # syriaairstrikes team commander , major mariam al mansouri in action

documents.title: pentagon on syrian trainees : 'we have n't even started '
text: in response to a question about what the us would do if assad attacks a syrian force the us plans to train and equip , kirby emphasizes how truly nascent the us-trained syrian ground force is : we have n't even started the training , he says .
more than 1 million iraqis are now receiving emergency food aid , the world food program ( wfp ) announced this week .
reuters reports : raed hamdoon is one of them .

he fled the northern city of mosul on foot in june with his four daughters as fighting intensified , and they have taken refuge in the relative safety of kurdistan , along with more than 850,000 other iraqis .
we escaped ( mosul ) because we feared for our lives , hamdoon said in an email interview with the thomson reuters foundation , translated by an aid group .
when we first arrived ( at a refugee camp in northern iraq ) we used to receive a little food that was not enough for me and my family .
now , they are receiving assistance packages from the wfp and are able to cook rice , pasta and tahini .
read the full piece here .
kirby is asked how long the pentagon was tracking khorasan .
i know that the name is not exactly a household name to many american people .
i 'll tell you that we 've been watching them for many many months .
president barack obama has addressed a us meeting on ebola ( earlier than the white house advertised ) .
here is video of his remarks : department of state ( @ statedept ) watch president obama 's full remarks at high-level # unga meeting on # ebolaresponse .
kirby says the pentagon does n't know whether leadership of the khorasan group have been killed .
we know we hit what we were aiming at we definitely know that we hit targets that belong to the , that were of use to them .
inside iraq , the effect us strikes are having on isis are more palpable , kirby says .
on their morale .
on their ability to maneuver .
on their ability to communicate .
and we know we 've forced them to change some of their tactics .
we 're definitely having an effect .
we know we 're having an effect on them in iraq but nobody 's doing touchdown dances here .
nobody 's doing high-5s .
the khorasan group is a different matter altogether , kirby says .
kirby says 200 of the 475 additional troops for iraq president obama announced in a speech earlier this month were on their way to baghdad and irbil .
138 will go to the baghdad operations center ; 68 to support kurdish forces from irbil and 10 at the ministry of defense in baghdad .
this 200 will be the first major contingent of the 475 , kirby says .
there 's been a handful , 7-10 , who 've gone to baghdad already , he says .
kirby says the current military operation does not have a name .
i know of no plans at this point to name it .
previously the pentagon had denied knowledge of any civilian casualties from the strikes in syria .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) kirby says defense department is looking into reports of civilian casualties .
kirby also said : u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) .
@ pentagonpressec re # syria : no other military on earth takes the concerns of civilian casualty as seriously as we do .
kirby is asked about reports that iranian revolutionary guard qods force head qassim suleimani is in northern iraq around irbil assisting the kurdish peshmerga in their fight against isis .
i do n't have anything on that specific case , kirby says .
he says it 's the first time he 's ever heard of it .
we are not communicating or coordinating with tehran on military activity in iraq , kirby says .
but he says , we know there 's qods force operatives inside iraq .
kirby has distributed before-and-after images of recent strikes : u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) .
@ pentagonpressec re # syria : before and after photos of the # gbiebe oil refinery targets of coalition attacks .
u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) .
@ pentagonpressec re # syria : before & after photos of # jeribe modular oil refinery targets of coalition attacks .
kirby : we 're not coordinating with the assad regime or the syrian military .
we 're not communicating with them .
question : why does n't us prevent syrian air strikes ? kirby : what i want to focus on is what we are doing , and that is going after strategic-level targets tied to isil .
kirby says the defense department has not seen much reaction by isil in response to the air strikes in syria .
in iraq , he says , reaction was visible to the haditha and mosul dam-area hits and the campaign around amerli .
baghdad is still relatively secure , he says .
the isf are still defending the capital .
and it 's not like isil does n't pose a threat there .
he says recent us strikes have hit targets south and southwest of baghdad to answer the isis threat .
guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman is watching rear adm. john kirby 's briefing at the pentagon .
kirby is talking about who flew the missions to hit the refineries .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) kirby leaning on saudi & uae aircraft attacking isis oil refineries more than us did .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) us , saudis & uae , kirby says , trying to blow up isis-held oil refineries w/o destroying a potential future $ source for post-assad syria
us president barack obama is at the un again today .
this afternoon he is scheduled to speak at a meeting on the ebola epidemic and then hold a bilateral meeting with egyptian president abdel fatah al-sisi .
carol lee ( @ carol e lee ) obama begins final day of unga w ethiopia pm mtg

not everyone warms fully to the idea that a nuclear accord with iran out to be pursued for the beginning of collaboration that rouhani described aimed at promoting security , peace & development : emile hokayem ( @ emile hokayem ) nuclear deal with iran is much-needed , but its merits will be based on its terms , not on overstated regional benefits ( i.e .

isis/syria etc ) here 's a critical appraisal of another point rouhani made : paul danahar ( @ pdanahar ) rouhani `` while [ others ] have fallen prey to war & turmoil , iran remains secure , stable & calm .
that 's cos a pop video can get you lashed .
rouhani is done .
up next is the president of tunisia .

guardian diplomatic editor julian borger notes that rouhani presented a nuclear deal as a potential doorway to further peace deals : julian borger ( @ julianborger ) if interlocutors are flexible , an entirely different environment will be created for solving other problems .

here 's the gist of what rouhani said on the to hassan rouhani ( @ hassanrouhani ) a final accord re iran 's peaceful nuclear program can serve as beginning of collaboration aimed at promoting security , peace & development .
arriving at a final comprehensive nuclear agreement with iran is an opportunity for the west to show that it does not discriminate , rouhani say .
he calls it an historic and exceptional opportunity .

documents.title: rouhani : 'we hope for final accord ' on nuclear program
text: rouhani turns to nuclear talks .
he encourages a swift conclusion of a final accord .

any delay at arriving at a final agreement [ comes ] not only at our expense but at the expense of others in the region and beyond , he says : no one should doubt that compromise and agreement on this issue is in the best interests of everyone .
we hope that the current negotiations will [ result ] in a final accord in the short time we have left .
[ ] we are determined to continue our negotiations with our interlocutors in good faith .
laura rozen ( @ lrozen ) rouhani fairly upbeat on nuclear negotiations , `` hope lead to final accord in short amount of time we have left . ''
# irantalks
rouhani calls for the same thing obama did : an international effort against terrorism .
i warn that if we do not muster all of our strengths against extremism and violence and fail to entrust the job to the people of the region this world will not be safe for anyone .
we are all in the same boat , he says .

then he delivers a line that suggests why it might be more complicated than that , saying that if there were better cooperation against terrorism , thousands of innocent palestinians in gaza would not have fallen victim to the zionists ' actions .
rouhani paints iran as a longtime opponent of terrorism .
recall , he says , that iran had called for international dialogue before the criminal act of september 11th .
his history does not go back further .
an english-language twitter account tied to rouhani is tweeting the text of his speech .

hassan rouhani ( @ hassanrouhani ) all those who have played a role in founding and supporting these terror groups must acknowledge their errors that have led to extremism.1/2 hassan rouhani ( @ hassanrouhani ) i 'm astonished these murderous groups call themselves # islamic .
western media repeats this false claim , which provokes hatred of all muslims
rouhani says strategic blunders by the west have created safe havens for terrorists .
he accuses the west of pursuing an erroneous strategic approach in the middle east .
rouhani is speaking .
he is describing the roots of terrorism .
to uproot extremism we must spread justice and development , he says .
the pain is made greater when these terrorists spill blood in the name of religion and behead in the name of islam , he says .
he says islam teaches that taking the blood of a single human destroys the whole of humanity .
fazel hawramy in irbil has more on the public execution in mosul of human rights lawyer sameera salih ali al nuaimy ( see earlier ) .

the un office in iraq said it had verified nuaimy 's execution with members of her family , people in the neighbourhood and her professional associates , including the un 's own human rights officer who is originally from mosul and was a friend of the victim .
a spokesman said : the execution occurred on monday in front of the governorate building in the dawasa area of central mosul .
on 15 september nuaimy had posted criticism of isis on her facebook page after the destruction of religious shrines in mosul .
she had been representing those charged before the mosul courts pro bono .
she was a well-known women 's rights activist and active on poverty issues .
last wednesday , isis militants stormed nuaimy 's house .
she was then put before a sharia court .
she was then subjected to torture for five days to force her to repent ' for what she had published , but she refused to do so and was then executed .
when isis militants handed her body to her family , the family confirmed that the body had marks of torture on it .
isis prevented the family from holding a funeral for her .
a source in mosul said he was is sure that she was killed by da'esh [ isis ] because she objected to the bombing of the nabi younes mosque in the city .
he added : i did not see her being killing by da'esh myself but i heard it from a close friend .
now people in mosul expecting air strikes in retaliation .
fashionably late .

roozbeh kaboly ( @ rzbh ) photo : entrance # iran president # rouhani # un # unga2014 # irantalks reza marashi ( @ rezamarashi ) little does the un know , if you tell our people breakfast is at 9am , we might just stroll in at 11am with a grin on our face , ready to eat .
there are reports that the iranian president has disappeared ( temporarily ?
erroneously ? )
from some versions of today ' un general assembly schedule .
update : rouhani 's speaking time apparently has been rearranged .
he 's up next , after president john dramani mahama of ghana , guardian diplomatic editor julian borger reports : julian borger ( @ julianborger ) rouhani is up next , after ghana .
he 's in the building apparently the un general assembly proceedings may be viewed on un web tv here .
hayes brown ( @ hayesbrown ) .
@ hassanrouhani has been removed from the schedule for the # unga .
he was there earlier .
kurdish fighters battling isis militants in kobani close to the turkish border are reported to have called for us air strikes in the area .
a statement from the kurdish separatist group the ypg , or people 's protection units , offers to share intelligence about isis positions if the us launches strikes on the area .

pieter van ostaeyen ( @ p vanostaeyen ) # ypg press statement : if us coalition helps kurds in # kobanãª they will provide intel on # is positions # syria there has been no confirmation of reports that air strikes were launched against isis from jets travelling from turkish airspace .
turkey denied it had given permission for its air space to be used .

documents.title: uae confirms female pilot involved in air strikes
text: the uae has confirmed that the country 's first female fighter pilot was involved in the first wave of attacks against islamic state militants in syria , the national reports .
major mariam al mansouri , 35 , an f-16 pilot , will lead further strikes , according to the uae 's country 's ambassador to the us , it said .
mansouri was featured in a news report from oman to the world earlier this month .
major mariam al-mansouri , the first female pilot to join the emirates air forces , led the squadron of uae fighter jets that participated in raids targeting islamic state jihadists in syria .
/afp/getty images
some british mps have been seeking the views of their constituents before voting tomorrow on the government 's plan to launch air strikes against isis militants in iraq .
the labour mp john mann , and the liberal democrats julian huppert and lynne featherstone have taken to social media to ask voters what they would do .
john mann mp ( @ johnmannmp ) air strikes against is in iraq ?

i want to hear the views of bassetlaw people before i vote in parliament on friday lynne featherstone ( @ lfeatherstone ) iraq and isil - julian huppert ( @ julianhuppert ) thanks for all the comments so far on what we ought to do about islamic state in syria and iraq - more thoughts very welcome !
# fb public opinion has shifted markedly in the last six weeks , according to yougov .
public opinion has moved dramatically on the issue of uk involvement in air strikes on isis in the past six weeks .

at the start of august , the public were roughly divided ( 37-36 % ) ; ever since the start of september - and the emergence of the beheading videos - there has been a consistent majority in favour of action ( 53-26 % ) .
last week yougov even found that a majority now supports air strikes against isis in syria an issue that mps will be not be voting on .
yougov ( @ yougov ) a majority of the british public now support raf strikes on is in syria : our @ twitterid poll
here 's a roundup of the latest developments : french fighter jets have launched new air strikes against isis targets in iraq , as paris considers extending the strikes to syria .
france 's possible participation in air strikes in syria is on the table , according to defence minister jean-yves le drian .
kurdish fighters are reported to have pushed back an isis advance around the syrian town kobani close to the border with turkey .
monitors said at least 12 islamic state militants and eight kurdish fighters were killed in the clashes .

an extremist preacher who said he had no sympathy for alan henning , the british hostage held by islamic state radical , has been arrested as part of an investigation into islamist terrorism.anjem choudary was one of nine men arrested in britain as part of the investigation .
david cameron told the united nations general assembly the uk was ready to play its part in confronting islamic state militants in iraq .

in what amounted to a rallying cry to mps to back military action when parliament is recalled on friday , the prime minister warned that britain must not be so frozen with fear of repeating the mistakes of the iraq war that it failed to take on the psychopathic , murderous , brutal jihadis .
the us and its arab partners carried out air strikes against oil refineries controlled by isis according to the latest update from the pentagon .
in an apparent attempt to stem the group 's cash flow , the air strikes are a continuation of the broader military campaign which began on monday against the militant group .
a 19-year-old from brighton who dreamed about martyrdom is believed to be the latest british jihadi to be killed in syria , having died in the past 48 hours .
militants in the war-torn country say khalil al-britani , whose real name is ibrahim kamara , died after a us air strike on aleppo this week .

president franã§ois hollande has confirmed that a french citizen kidnapped in algeria was beheaded by isls-linked militants , and said the murder would only serve to reinforce his determination to support efforts against the jihadists .

the group calling itself jund al-khilafah or soldiers of the caliphate released a video that appeared to de the beheading of hervã© gourdel , 55 , a mountain guide from nice who had only arrived in algeria the previous day .
syrian government forces overran rebels in a town northeast of damascus strengthening president bashar al-assad 's grip on territory around the capital , reuters reports .
the town - adra al-omalia - is about 30 km ( 19 miles ) from central damascus but far from parts of syria where the united states has launched air strikes against islamic state militants .
syrian state tv said the armed forces had imposed their control over the city of adra al-omalia and eliminated a number of terrorists .
troops were combing the area and clearing out explosives planted by militants , it added .

assad 's forces , backed by the lebanese shia movement hezbollah , have been gradually extending control over a corridor of territory from damascus to the mediterranean coast this year , seizing towns and villages along the main north-south highway and in the mountainous qalamoun area along the lebanese border .
the advances in adra al-omalia show that the government is continuing to press that campaign as us led forces bombard islamic state positions elsewhere in the country .

the british-based syrian observatory for human rights confirmed the government had taken control of adra al-omalia after clashes with rebels including some from the nusra front , al qaeda 's affiliate in syria , whose positions have also been hit by us air strikes .

the observatory , which monitors the conflict through a network of sources , earlier said at least 29 people - 18 of them rebel fighters - died during fighting on wednesday between insurgents and government forces in the outskirts of damascus .
state tv broadcast what is said was live footage from the town showing soldiers standing in the area near buildings that had collapsed or were smashed up .
an injured girl lies on a bed at a makeshift hospital in the besieged rebel bastion of douma , northeast of the syrian capital damascus .
doumany/afp/getty images
this map shows the location of the isis controlled oil refineries in eastern syria hit by the us and its arab allies .
french fighter jets struck isis targets in iraq on thursday , government spokesman stephane le foll said .
there were strikes in iraq this morning , le foll said without giving any further details , reuters reports .
the strikes were the first by french jets since 19 september when paris joined the united states military action against islamic state insurgents in iraq .
france is also considering whether to extend air strikes into syria , according to its defence minister jean-yves le drian .

fighting around the syrian town kobani close to the border with turkey has claimed the lives of 12 islamic state militants and eight kurdish fighters , according to the latest update from the syrian observatory for human rights .
earlier kurdish forces were reported to have pushed back an isis advance around kobani .
twitter user agathocle desyracuse has been mapping the battle .
agathocle desyracuse ( @ desyracuse ) # kobane map update / final battle about to start as # is pushes from south .
# syria
parliament is expected to back the government 's plans to join the us and france in launching air strikes against isis targets in iraq .

deputy prime minister nick clegg and labour leader ed miliband each confirmed that they would be backing the pm 's call for military action when parliament is recalled to vote on the issue on friday .

miliband , who spoke to cameron before the recall was announced and has been briefed by national security officials - said : we will learn the lessons of the past - but we will not turn away from threats to our national interest .
labour 's press team endorsed sentiments by former labour minister john denham who resigned over the us-led invasion of iraq in 2003 but who said he backs air strikes in iraq now .
john denham ( @ johndenhammp ) in 2003 i resigned over iraq , but in 1992 i called for intervention in bosnia .
this is a 1992 moment , not a 2003 .
the white house has released video of barack obama 's meeting with iraq 's new prime minister haider al-abadi .
obama told abadi that the us could not defeat isis for the iraqi government , but that it would be a strong partner , in the campaign .
abadi said iraq was in dire need of new weapons and equipment after much of its armoury fell into the hands of isis .

documents.title: human rights lawyer executed in mosul
text: islamic state militants have publicly killed a human rights lawyer in the iraqi city of mosul after finding her guilty of apostasy in a self-styled islamic court , according to the un .

the un assistance mission in iraq says samira salih al-nuaimi was seized from her home last week after allegedly posting messages on facebook that were critical of the militants ' destruction of places of worship in mosul .
the gulf center for human rights said wednesday that al-nuaimi had worked on detainee rights and poverty .
isis seized iraq 's second largest city mosul in june during its rapid advance across the country 's north and west .

nickolay e. mladenov ( @ nmladenov ) shocked at at the unspeakable way # humanrights activists sameera al-nuaimy was seized from her home , tortured and murdered by isil in # iraq nuaimi 's execution was also reported by amnesty 's kristyan benedict .
kristyan benedict ( @ kreasechan ) isis execute lawyer & human rights defender samira saleh al-naimi in a public square # rip
downing street has published the full text of david cameron 's speech to the un general assembly .
you can gauge the main thrust of what he had to say from a wordle version of the speech .
the prime minister made clear he wants the uk to take part in air strikes in iraq , but not syria .
wordle cameron 's speech
hours before his arrest this morning anjem choudary appeared to used social media to criticise us-led air strikes against islamic state militants in syria and iraq .
a twitter account under his name accused the us and uk of killing civilians .
anjem choudary ( @ anjemchoudary ) fact : the us/uk will never defeat the islamic state by bombs from the air , rather they will yet again murder innocent men , women & children !

anjem choudary ( @ anjemchoudary ) fact : the definition of terrorism is more suitable for the us/uk policy in muslim lands than those who are removing their oppressive regimes choudary is understood to be one of nine men arrested today as part of an investigation into islamist terrorism .
the men , who were all seized in london , were arrested on sus of being members of , or supporting , a banned organisation , the metropolitan police said .
al-muhajiroun is understood to be the banned organisation in question counter-terrorism police are searching 18 addresses across london , and one in stoke-on-trent , pa reported .

the men , who are aged between 22 and 51 , were arrested as part of an ongoing investigation into islamist-related terrorism and are not in response to any immediate public safety risk , scotland yard said .
kurdish forces in northern syria pushed back an advance by islamic state fighters towards the border town of kobani in overnight clashes , two kurdish officials told reuters .
islamic state launched a fresh offensive to try to capture kobani more than a week ago after months of fighting .
more than 100,000 kurds have fled the town and surrounding villages , crossing over the nearby border into turkey .
officials said islamic state had concentrated their fighters south of kobani late on wednesday and had pushed towards the town but kurdish ypg forces repelled them .
the ypg responded and pushed them back to about 10-15 km ( 6-9 miles ) away , idris nassan , deputy minister for foreign affairs in the kobani canton , told reuters by telephone .
ocalan iso , a kurdish defence official , confirmed that ypg forces had stemmed islamic state 's advances south of kobani , known as ayn al-arab in arabic .
as our fighters secured the area , we found 12 islamic state bodies , he said by telephone .
islamic state fighters also remain to the east and west of the town and fighting continues in the south .
both men said they had also heard warplanes flying over kobani late on wednesday for the first time , but it was not clear exactly which areas they were targeting .
a turkish soldier stands by as syrian refugees wait for permission to enter turkey at yumurtalik crossing gate near suruc .
more than 200,000 people fleeing the islamic state militants advance on kobani , syria , arrived in turkey over the last five days to find safety .
ozbilici/ap
lebanon 's army has detained about 450 suspected islamist militants near its border with syria , as dramatic emerged of the arrests at the frontier town of arsal .
the town was the scene last month , of the deadliest spillover of fighting in the three-year civil war in syria , reuters reports .
during those clashes that killed dozens , militants captured a group of lebanese soldiers and have since killed at least three of them .
they are believed to be holding more than a dozen others .

in the last two weeks , the lebanese army has arrested hundreds of mostly syrian suspects there that it accuses of being members of extremist groups such as nusra front , syria 's al qaida wing , which is fighting syrian president bashar al-assad 's forces .
the army said on thursday it had searched a camp near the border for suspects .
sunni muslim militants and other groups in syria accuse the lebanese army of working with hezbollah , the lebanese shia movement which has sent fighters to help assad 's forces .

zaid benjamin ( @ zaidbenjamin ) ø±ø¦ùø³ ø§ùø§ø¦øªùø§ù ø§ùø³ùø±ù ùø§ø¯ù ø§ùø¨ø­ø±ø© ùø­ù ù ø§ùø­ùùù ø© ø§ùùø¨ùø§ùùø© ù ø³ø¤ùùùø© ø³ùø§ù ø© ø§ùùø§ø¬ø¦ùù ø§ùø³ùø±ùùù ø¹ùø¨ ù ø¯ø§ùù ø§øª # ø¹ø±ø³ø§ù conflict reporter ( @ conflict report ) # remember : the folks in the background are the # good guys , arresting syrian refugees in # lebanon !

documents.title: extremist preacher arrested
text: an extremist preacher who said he had no sympathy for alan henning , the british hostage held by islamic state radical , has been arrested as part of an investigation into islamist terrorism .
anjem choudary was one of nine men arrested today as part of the investigation , sources told the press association .
earlier this week choudary said he did not feel sorry for henning .
he was quoted as saying : i do n't know the real story , i only heard from the british government and media .
we need to hear directly from the islamic state as to why he is being held .
the decision lies in the hands of the caliphate .
muslim preacher anjem choudary who is one of nine men arrested as part of an investigation into islamist terrorism .
lipinski/pa
the battle for control of syria 's eastern oil fields was covered last year in special report by the guardian 's ghaith abdul-ahad .
at the time he wrote : the hard edges of syria 's frontlines dogmatic , revolutionary , islamist or pure murderously sectarian almost melt away outside the oilfields .

new lines emerge pitting tribesmen against battalions , islamists against everyone else , and creating sometimes surreal lines of engagement , where rebels help maintain government oil supplies in return for their villages being spared from bombardment and being allowed to siphon oil for themselves .
a syrian works on a home-made refinery in deir el-zour .
rebel-held oilfields sell crude to peasants , who use primitive techniques to make petrol .
abdul-ahad
the cabinet is due to meet at 1pm today to discuss iraq 's request for air strikes against islamic state militants .
parliament has been recalled to debate the issue on friday .

cameron made clear that he envisaged british warplanes joining coalition air strikes within iraq , after receiving a request for military help from the country 's new prime minister haider al-abadi , but stressed there would be no boots on the ground .
iraqi prime minister haider al-abadi addresses members of the un security council on wednesday jacobson/ap

france 's possible participation in air strikes on islamic state targets in syria is on the table , defence minister said hours after president francois hollande ruled out such strikes , reuters reports .

france has joined the coalition bombing of islamic state targets in iraq on the basis it was asked for help by baghdad , but has refrained from doing so in syria , instead supporting the moderate opposition against syrian president bashar al-assad .
but jean-yves le drian told rtl radio when asked about the possibility france might join raids in syria : the opportunity is not there today .
we already have an important task in iraq and we will see in the coming days how the situation evolves .
pressed further on whether it was a possibility in future , le drian - who is taking part in a war cabinet meeting with hollande on thursday - said : the question is on the table .
france 's foreign minister laurent fabius said this week there was no legal barrier to such a move .
since then , algerian militants claiming allegiance to islamic state released a video on wednesday showing the beheading of a french tourist .
le drian also said french miltary aircraft were at this very moment in action over iraq .

britain 's foreign secretary philip hammond has ruled out coordinating attacks against isis militants with the syria government and accused the regime of bashar al-assad of being responsible for the group 's rise .
speaking after chairing a meeting of the friends of syria group at the sidelines of the un general assembly in new york , hammond said : assad can not be a credible partner for us .
he is unable to unite syrians , unable to defeat isil and unable to win broad , international backing .
he is responsible for isil 's rise .
assad is a cause , not a cure , of isil .
on wednesday syria urged britain and the west to fight alongside syria against isis .
bassam abu abdullah , from syria 's information ministry , said : we are facing the same enemy .

in his statement hammond added : the friends of syria today expressed their support once again for the vision of a syria free of tyranny and terrorism , enjoying democracy , pluralism and human rights under the rule of law and again today , we 've made our commitment to work with the moderate opposition , led by the syrian national coalition , to turn that vision into a reality for all of the people of syria .

british foreign secretary philip hammond shakes hands with syrian national coalition president hadi al-bahra at the end of a media briefing at the united nations headquarters in new york munoz/reuters

at least 14 islamic state militants were killed in wednesday 's attack on oil refineries in eastern syria , according to an update from uk-based monitoring group the syrian observatory for human rights .
foreign fighters were among the dead , it said , without providing details .
most of the oil refinery air strikes were conducted by jets from arab nations , according to cnn 's jim sciutto .

jim sciutto ( @ jimsciutto ) more detail : saudi & uae flew 2/3 of aircraft & hit majority of targets in tonight 's # syriaairstrikes on # isis oil facilities the us confirmed that saudi arabia and the uae jets were involved in the raids .
isis militants can make millions of dollars a day from the oil refineries they control in syria and iraq , according to analyst michael stephens from the security thinktank rusi .
speaking to bbc radio 4 's today programme he said it was a sensible strategy for the us to target oil installations controlled by the group .
he said : at the end of the day if you want to degrade isis , you 've got to cut them off financially as well as militarily .
once you do that they ca n't pay their fighters regularly , they ca n't pay their civil servants and then as a result the organisation will start to struggle .
stephens pointed out that isis-controlled oil refineries in iraq were off limits from us strikes at the request of the iraqi government .
it is up to the iraqi army to take those wells back , he said .
us central command said 13 of air strikes were launched in remote areas of eastern syria to hit oil facilities around al mayadin , al hasakah , abu kamal and deir al-zor .
in a statement it said : we are still assessing the outcome of the attack on the refineries , but have initial indications that the strikes were successful .
these small-scale refineries provided fuel to run isil operations , money to finance their continued attacks throughout iraq and syria , and an economic asset to support their future operations .
producing between 300-500 barrels of refined petroleum per day , isil is estimated to generate as much as $ 2 million per day from these refineries .
the destruction and degradation of these targets further limits isil 's ability to lead , control , project power and conduct operations .
the us conducted these strikes as part of the president 's comprehensive strategy to degrade and ultimately destroy isil .

going forward , the us and partner nations will continue to conduct targeted airstrikes against isil in syria and iraq and support iraqi forces as they go on the offensive against this terrorist group .

welcome to live coverage of the us-led battle against islamic state militants in iraq and syria after david cameron made his pitch to join the campaign , and the us and its arab partners launched air strikes against isis-controlled oil refineries in syria .
here 's a roundup of the latest developments : david cameron told the united nations general assembly the uk was ready to play its part in confronting islamic state militants in iraq .

in what amounted to a rallying cry to mps to back military action when parliament is recalled on friday , the prime minister warned that britain must not be so frozen with fear of repeating the mistakes of the iraq war that it failed to take on the psychopathic , murderous , brutal jihadis .
the us and its arab partners carried out air strikes against oil refineries controlled by isis according to the latest update from the pentagon .
in an apparent attempt to stem the group 's cash flow , the air strikes are a continuation of the broader military campaign which began on monday against the militant group .
western leaders vowed to lead a global coalition to destroy the isis extremist movement , as president obama warned the militants to leave the battlefield while they can .

the quickening pace of the military campaign against isis dominated proceedings at the united nations general assembly in new york , where obama issued a call to arms against what he called isis 's network of death .
un secretary general ban ki-moon cautioned against a military-only response to terrorism .
in his address to the un assembly he said : missiles may kill terrorists .
but good governance kills terrorism .
free and independent societies free from suffering , oppression and occupation this is what will kill terrorism .
a 19-year-old from brighton who dreamed about martyrdom is believed to be the latest british jihadi to be killed in syria , having died in the past 48 hours .
militants in the war-torn country say khalil al-britani , whose real name is ibrahim kamara , died after a us air strike on aleppo this week .

president franã§ois hollande has confirmed that a french citizen kidnapped in algeria was beheaded by isls-linked militants , and said the murder would only serve to reinforce his determination to support efforts against the jihadists .

the group calling itself jund al-khilafah or soldiers of the caliphate released a video that appeared to de the beheading of hervã© gourdel , 55 , a mountain guide from nice who had only arrived in algeria the previous day .

bulletin.text: Pentagon has not seen much reaction' by Isis to Syria air strikes.
We're definitely having an effect' in Iraq, spokesman says.
Iranian president calls for final accord' on nuclear program.
France steps up domestic anti-terrorism precautions.
David Cameron makes UN pitch to join battle against Isis.
